properties.title: Introduce Block Protocol v0.2 and custom element support
properties.body:
This PR introduces the new specification, docs and tooling for version 0.2 of the Block Protocol:
- new spec pages
- new doc pages
- package updates:
  - new `@blockprotocol/graph` package for use by block protocol authors and embedding applications
  - new `@blockprotocol/core` package which is used by the graph package
  - update `mock-block-dock` for the new spec

As part of this it introduces proper custom element / web component support:
- `custom-element` as a specified `blockType`
- new `custom-element` template via `create-block-app` 
- `mock-block-dock` support for custom elements

repo.description: Data management, integration and modeling with blocks #

properties.body: ## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR? Adds a block for visualising GitHub PRs. ## 🔗 Related links - #503 (Related) ## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs? - Not to my knowledge ## ⚠️ Known issues - The HASH app fails to load the block from `yarn dev` but succeeds with `yarn serve` - The block currently resolves all entities by itself, rather than relying on links in the ontology (e.g. it looks up and filters IssueEvents rather than looking for ones **linked** to a PR) - The block relies on the three entity types being available within the embedding application and finds them by expecting their titles to be `GithubPullRequest`, `GithubReview` and `GithubIssueEvent` respectively. This is necessary until types have URIs or other identifiers. ## 🐾 Next steps - Iterate on the design - Resolve entities through links - Identify EntityTypeIds through a better mechanism ## 🛡 What tests cover this? - None to my knowledge ## ❓ How to test this? ### Seeding the data - checkout `am/source-github` (#503) - Follow instructions of (#503) in **How to test this?** up until the mutations - Run mutations: - `executeGithubCheckTask` - this confirms that it’s working and that your authentication token is good - executeGithubDiscoverTask - this queries for the available datastreams and generates the types within your workspace - It is possible that this will get angry about folder structure - Edit the packages/hash/task-executor/src/tasks/source-github/secrets/catalog.json to only contain the JSON objects with the following stream names: `pull_requests`, `reviews`, `issue_events` - Run the executeGithubReadTask mutation, probably with a timestamp of a few days - Go grab a coffee (it’s only a few minutes, there are some logs in the task-executor process that will say it received messages, and then how many records it found ### Testing the Block - Swap branch back to `am/github-pr-overview-block` - In packages/blocks/github-pr-overview run yarn build && yarn serve (the yarn dev command seems broken 🙃 ) - Test block as normal ## 📹 Demo
properties.title: Add GitHub PR Overview block

repo.name: hash

properties.body:
## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR?

<!-- Explain, at a high level, what this does and why. -->
<!-- Use the 'What does this change?' section to list more specific implementation details. -->
Currently the Block Config Menu doesn't
1. properly handle changes to properties of type "number". changes to properties get saved as a string even though the property type is a number
1. handle displaying input for properties that can either be a number or string. i.e properties with type ["number", "string"]

I noticed this when working on #515 . This PR fixes both issues 

## 🔗 Related links

<!-- Add links to any context it is worth capturing (e.g. Issues, Discussions, Discord, Asana) -->
<!-- Mark any links which are not publically accessible as _(internal)_ -->
<!-- Don't rely on links to explain the PR, especially internal ones: use the sections above -->

- [Asana task](link) _(internal)_

## 🚫 Blocked by

<!-- If the pull request is blocked by anything, list the blockers here. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to them. -->

- [ ] ...

## 🔍 What does this change?

<!-- Use a bullet list to explain your changes in more detail, if it would be helpful. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to the specific commit.-->

- Update `updateProperty` to properly handle changes when the property type is "number" or ["number", "string"]
- Render an input when the property type is an array that contains "number"

## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs?

<!-- If this adds a user facing feature or modifies how an existing feature is used, it likely needs a docs change. -->

- No
properties.title: Block Configuration Menu Updates

auto_merge.commit_message:
* update config menu to properly handle number property type

* update conditional in updateProperty

issue.body: ## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR? Adds a block for visualising GitHub PRs. ## 🔗 Related links - #503 (Related) ## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs? - Not to my knowledge ## ⚠️ Known issues - The HASH app fails to load the block from `yarn dev` but succeeds with `yarn serve` - The block currently resolves all entities by itself, rather than relying on links in the ontology (e.g. it looks up and filters IssueEvents rather than looking for ones **linked** to a PR) - The block relies on the three entity types being available within the embedding application and finds them by expecting their titles to be `GithubPullRequest`, `GithubReview` and `GithubIssueEvent` respectively. This is necessary until types have URIs or other identifiers. ## 🐾 Next steps - Iterate on the design - Resolve entities through links - Identify EntityTypeIds through a better mechanism ## 🛡 What tests cover this? - None to my knowledge ## ❓ How to test this? ### Seeding the data - checkout `am/source-github` (#503) - Follow instructions of (#503) in **How to test this?** up until the mutations - Run mutations: - `executeGithubCheckTask` - this confirms that it’s working and that your authentication token is good - executeGithubDiscoverTask - this queries for the available datastreams and generates the types within your workspace - It is possible that this will get angry about folder structure - Edit the packages/hash/task-executor/src/tasks/source-github/secrets/catalog.json to only contain the JSON objects with the following stream names: `pull_requests`, `reviews`, `issue_events` - Run the executeGithubReadTask mutation, probably with a timestamp of a few days - Go grab a coffee (it’s only a few minutes, there are some logs in the task-executor process that will say it received messages, and then how many records it found ### Testing the Block - Swap branch back to `am/github-pr-overview-block` - In packages/blocks/github-pr-overview run yarn build && yarn serve (the yarn dev command seems broken 🙃 ) - Test block as normal ## 📹 Demo

issue.body:
## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR?

<!-- Explain, at a high level, what this does and why. -->
<!-- Use the 'What does this change?' section to list more specific implementation details. -->
Currently the Block Config Menu doesn't
1. properly handle changes to properties of type "number". changes to properties get saved as a string even though the property type is a number
1. handle displaying input for properties that can either be a number or string. i.e properties with type ["number", "string"]

I noticed this when working on #515 . This PR fixes both issues 

## 🔗 Related links

<!-- Add links to any context it is worth capturing (e.g. Issues, Discussions, Discord, Asana) -->
<!-- Mark any links which are not publically accessible as _(internal)_ -->
<!-- Don't rely on links to explain the PR, especially internal ones: use the sections above -->

- [Asana task](link) _(internal)_

## 🚫 Blocked by

<!-- If the pull request is blocked by anything, list the blockers here. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to them. -->

- [ ] ...

## 🔍 What does this change?

<!-- Use a bullet list to explain your changes in more detail, if it would be helpful. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to the specific commit.-->

- Update `updateProperty` to properly handle changes when the property type is "number" or ["number", "string"]
- Render an input when the property type is an array that contains "number"

## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs?

<!-- If this adds a user facing feature or modifies how an existing feature is used, it likely needs a docs change. -->

- No
